definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: Small and portable, the iron cauldron was once used as a field cauldron, according to experts.
sentences.chinese: 据专家介绍铁釜是一种行军锅，它体积小，便于携带。

sentences.english: John turned up for the ten-mile walk equipped for something more like an assault on Everest.
sentences.chinese: 约翰转而开始了十英里的行军，全副武装。

sentences.english: This was the Bataan death march.
sentences.chinese: 这就是巴丹半岛的死亡行军。

sentences.english: The hungry marchers shambled slowly along the road.
sentences.chinese: 行军的人饿得步履蹒跚在路上慢慢走着。

sentences.english: After a long day the range you relax by watching "Red Dawn".
sentences.chinese: 行军一整天后，你看《赤色黎明》来放松。

sentences.english: On their long march, the King and his army made camp for the night wherever they could.
sentences.chinese: 在行军途中，国王每晚都要依地扎营。

sentences.english: That wasn't a run it was a death march .
sentences.chinese: 这就是巴丹半岛的死亡行军。

sentences.english: Spain are used everywhere in place of the march, dance paso doble.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的每一个地方都是用斗牛舞代替行军舞。

sentences.english: The Brazilian rainforests around the Manos is the place to come if you want to see Army Ants on the march.
sentences.chinese: 巴西曼诺斯附近的雨林是观看兵蚁行军的最佳地点。

sentences.english: He hurried on, lest he should drop out in the forced match.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，生怕在急行军中掉队。

sentences.english: At night he would lie sleepless on his cot, suffering an almost unbearable frustration.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他躺在行军床上睡不着觉，灰心丧气难熬难挨。

sentences.english: Your bivouac for the night is the spot where you got tired of marching that day.
sentences.chinese: 你夜间的宿营地是你白天行军累了的处所。

sentences.english: Reconnoitre the soldiers marching speed limited.
sentences.chinese: 加强营战士们行军速度有限。

sentences.english: The derro make haste to their new settlement at a forced march.
sentences.chinese: 迪洛矮人向新定居点急行军。

sentences.english: The soldier proportioned his pace to the march.
sentences.chinese: 战士调制步子以便与行军的步伐一致。

definition: to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
